title: aintdatsumish
author: aintdatsumish
created_time: February 15, 2023, 07:28:15 PMLast edit: February 16, 2023, 07:55:22 PM by aintdatsumish
content: Newbie question. Thanks for your attention!I setup and downloaded latest firmware on my 2 new S19 90T's using Braiins pool. Everything was great for a while then I keep getting an abnormal hash rate and the units stop hashing. Seems to occur more often when both rigs are running. I have been running just 1 until I can get to the bottom of this issue. When I run both they will hash for an undetermined amount of time 1-2hrs. ish then 1 will go down I will restart then soon the other will stop hashing then back and forth. I had 1 hashing for as long as 2 days before an issue occurred but there is no real pattern to it, it's more frequent when both rigs are running. Could this be my network? Or could it be the pool? I appreciate any input just trying to keep hashing and troubleshooting in the right direction. Thank You!

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Please share with us the logs of your Antminer, it will help to investigate the issue You can use the "Insert Code" button when typing your reply here or pastebin to share the logs

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Where did you run these miners? Is it a closed room? If yes then it is due to overheating that is why the hashrate is drop or throttle. You need to take the hot air out from the room to cool down the miner if the miner is very hot the hashrate will drop or the miner will stop. And also, I suggest you to also try it to other pool like ViaBTC pool.

comments.author: aintdatsumish
comments.body: Inlet temps 65 /outlet 76 and miner temp states normal consistently. Wouldn't I be getting an abnormal high temp error if that was the case? Thanks!

comments.author: aintdatsumish
comments.body: chain = 2 set freq to 675.002023-02-16 00:48:30 enter mixed freq cfg2023-02-16 00:48:30 pulse_mode = 1, ccdly_sel = 0, pwth_sel = 12023-02-16 00:48:30 start do_core_reset2023-02-16 00:48:43 end do_core_reset2023-02-16 00:48:53 set_voltage_by_steps to 1580.2023-02-16 00:48:55 create thread pic_heart_beat_thread2023-02-16 00:48:55 Init done!2023-02-16 00:48:55 STATUS_OKAY2023-02-16 00:48:55 start the cached job2023-02-16 00:48:55 Version num 655362023-02-16 00:48:55 Mask num 0x1fffe0002023-02-16 00:48:55 opt_multi_version = 65536, interval timeout = 22906482023-02-16 00:48:55 freq = 675, percent = 90, hcn = 3883, timeout = 22906482023-02-16 00:48:55 set_start_time_point total_tv_start_sys=170 total_tv_end_sys=1712023-02-16 00:48:57 enable power watchdog: 0x00012023-02-16 01:17:46 30m avg rate is 91721.51 in 28 mins2023-02-16 01:47:49 30m avg rate is 91375.94 in 30 mins2023-02-16 02:17:52 30m avg rate is 91566.21 in 30 mins2023-02-16 02:45:25 !!! reg crc error2023-02-16 02:45:25 !!! reg crc error2023-02-16 02:45:25 !!! reg crc error2023-02-16 02:45:30 chain avg vol drop from 1580 to 1.902023-02-16 02:45:30 ERROR_POWER_LOST: power voltage rise or drop, pls check!2023-02-16 02:45:30 stop_mining: power voltage rise or drop, pls check!2023-02-16 02:45:30 uninit_temp_info2023-02-16 02:45:30 do not read temp anymore...2023-02-16 02:45:30 cancel thread2023-02-16 02:45:30 cancel thread2023-02-16 02:45:30 ****power off hashboard****2023-02-16 02:45:31 temp monitor thread exit2023-02-16 02:47:55 30m avg rate is 83989.76 in 30 mins2023-02-16 03:02:55 chain 0 hash rate 0.00 low in 15 mins2023-02-16 03:02:55 chain 1 hash rate 0.00 low in 15 mins2023-02-16 03:02:55 chain 2 hash rate 0.00 low in 15 mins

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I hope next time put the whole logs so that we can check the logs from the beginning to the end and make sure to put them inside the insert code tag it's a # button while editing your post.Anyway, based on the error "power voltage rise or drop, pls check!" it looks like a PSU issue.Do you have stable power?Have you plugged the miner directly into the power outlet?Â  Try to plug if not.If you use an extension with a thin gauge it won't give enough power so make sure that you have an extension with a big gauge that can handle 3300w.And take note this unit only works on 200~240v if you have a 110v outlet then this won't work.
